intro: Pavetta hochstetteri var. graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the wet season. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
